May 2k, 1951
Mr* eymour Siegel
President
PASS
Hew York City, Hew York
Dear Bit
I want to follow up on your suggestion that I forward a
copy of the tentative program for the fell meeting to every person
who was registered at the Institute in Columbus. These should
go out on NAKB stationery and in HAEB envelopes. My supply of
both is a bit low. Would you please forward to me as soon as
possible about 1,000 envelopes and 1,000 sheets of HAS® letter¬
head. I will mimeograph the program on plain white paper*
My operational budget for the year is in the red——with
four months more to go so I would like MAEB to provide me with
stamps for this big mailing job. There were about 800 people
in attendance at the Ohio Institute. In addition to the above
mailing, I shall get letters out to every NASB member station
asking for a complete station directory. That will take about
100 stamps more-a total of about 900 3£ stamps. This will
msfcn about ?27.00 worth of stamps which I ordinarily could absorb
from my own budget but, as I said above, my budget for the year
is already in the red and I am behind the eight ball with my
University without asking for that much money for stamps. If
you could arrange for Mr. Griffith to send me the stamps right
away, I should appreciate it.
I realise that I can’t get these stamps and supplies in
here before I leave but I will dictate all the necessary letters,
and have everything ready for my secretary to mail out as soon as
these supplies and stamps come in. She will continue to build
our complete station directory and will continue to work with
Hr* Griffith and the regional directors on new membership drive
while I am in school. I should appreciate your moving these two
requests along as soon as possible so we can get these two big
projects under way immediately.
My best to you.
Sincerely,
Graydon Ausraus
Vice-President
GA/ns
